unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassettes, Embrace the Stream: Music's Got a New Groove!
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassettes, Embrace the Stream: Music's Got a New Groove!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Remember painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto cassette tapes? Or saving up pocket money to buy that one CD of your favourite Bollywood film? Those days feel like a lifetime ago, right? Thanks to music streaming, accessing almost any song you can imagine is now as easy as ordering a chai online.
normalised: Hey everyone! Remember painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto cassette tapes? Or saving up pocket money to buy that one C D of your favourite Bollywood film? Those days feel like a lifetime ago, right? Thanks to music streaming, accessing almost any song you can imagine is now as easy as ordering a chai online.

unnormalised: We're talking instant access to millions of tracks, from the latest chart-toppers to obscure Indian classical ragas that would make Pandit Jasraj ji proud. Platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, JioSaavn – they're all battling for our ears and offering insane value. Forget shelling out Rs. 500 for one album; now you're paying a fraction of that for practically unlimited listening.

unnormalised: Think about it: You’re stuck in Bangalore traffic, inching forward at a snail's pace on Hosur Road. Instead of succumbing to road rage, you can cue up a playlist of A.R. Rahman's classics, or even discover a new indie artist from Chennai. My cousin, Priya, uses it to learn new bhajans – way easier than finding sheet music, she says!

unnormalised: And the best part? These services are constantly learning your taste. They’ll suggest new artists and genres you might like, expanding your musical horizons way beyond the usual Bollywood suspects. I personally rediscovered ghazals thanks to a random Spotify recommendation.

unnormalised: Plus, the algorithms are getting so good! They know exactly what mood I'm in. Need some energy for a workout? Boom! High-octane Punjabi beats. Feeling mellow after a long day? Instant access to soulful Sufi tunes.

unnormalised: Of course, there are debates about artist royalties and the impact on the music industry. But as a consumer, the sheer convenience and accessibility of music streaming is undeniable. From the ghats of Varanasi to the beaches of Goa, music is literally in the air – accessible to everyone with a smartphone and an internet connection.

unnormalised: So, ditch those dusty old cassettes and join the streaming revolution. Your ears (and your wallet) will thank you. What are you listening to these days? Let me know in the comments! Maybe I'll add it to my next road trip playlist, for that 500 km drive back home for Diwali!
